alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 11:46AM PST until December 14 at 12:30PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 245 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, La Mesa, Poway, Ramona, Del Mar, Valley Center, Fallbrook, University City, Tierrasanta, La Jolla, Linda Vista, Camp Pendleton, Mission Valley, Mission Beach, Hillcrest and North Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
